data.text:
Ann Graham1

F, #541831, d. 1835

Last Edited=11 Apr 2015

Ann Graham was the daughter of James Graham.2 She married John Nicholson, son of James Nicholson and Ann Bowman, in 1771.1 She died in 1835.1

From 1771, her married name became Nicholson.

Child of Ann Graham and John Nicholson

John Nicholson+2 b. 20 Feb 1778, d. 24 Nov 1846

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 2, page 2895. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S37] BP2003. [S37]

John Nicholson1

M, #541832, b. 20 February 1778, d. 24 November 1846

Last Edited=11 Apr 2015

John Nicholson was born on 20 February 1778.1 He was the son of John Nicholson and Ann Graham.2 He married Ellen Payne, daughter of Richard Payne, in 1811.1 He died on 24 November 1846 at age 68.1

He lived at Upper Clapton, London, England.1 He also had three elder sons and four daughters.1

Child of John Nicholson and Ellen Payne

William Nicholson+2 b. 2 Sep 1824, d. 25 Jul 1909

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 2, page 2895. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S37] BP2003. [S37]

Benjamin Henry Blackwell1

M, #541835, b. 1849

Last Edited=21 Sep 2012

Benjamin Henry Blackwell was born in 1849 at Oxford, Oxfordshire, England.1 He married Lydia Taylor in 1886 at Headington, Oxfordshire, England.1

He was founder of Blackwell's Bookshops.1

Children of Benjamin Henry Blackwell and Lydia Taylor

Dorothy Sterling Blackwell1 b. 1888

Sir Basil Henry Blackwell+1 b. 1889, d. 1984

Citations

[S4567] Bill Norton, "re: Pitman Family," e-mail message to Darryl Roger LUNDY (101053), 6 April 2010 and 19 April 2011. Hereinafter cited as "re: Pitman Family."

Isabella Sarah Meek1

F, #541837, b. circa 1835, d. 26 September 1934

Last Edited=11 Apr 2015

Isabella Sarah Meek was born circa 1835.1 She was the daughter of John Meek.2 She married William Nicholson, son of John Nicholson and Ellen Payne, in 1858.1 She died on 26 September 1934.1

From 1858, her married name became Nicholson.

Children of Isabella Sarah Meek and William Nicholson

Rt. Hon. William Graham Nicholson1

M, #541838, b. 11 March 1862, d. 29 July 1942

Last Edited=29 Oct 2016

Rt. Hon. William Graham Nicholson was born on 11 March 1862.1 He was the son of William Nicholson and Isabella Sarah Meek.2 He married Alice Margaret Beach, daughter of Rt. Hon. William Wither Bramston Beach and Caroline Chichester Cleveland, on 19 July 1890.1 He died on 29 July 1942 at age 80.1

He was educated at Harrow School, Harrow, London, England.1 He graduated from Trinity College, Cambridge University, Cambridge, Cambridgeshire, England, with a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.)1 He held the office of Member of Parliament (M.P.) (Conservative) for East Hampshire between 1897 and 1935.1 He held the office of Justice of the Peace (J.P.) for Hampshire.1 He was Lieutenant-Colonel and Hon. Colonel of the 3rd Battalion, Hampshire Regiment.1 He held the office of Deputy Lieutenant (D.L.) of Hampshire.1 He was appointed Privy Counsellor (P.C.) in 1925.1 He lived at Basing Park, Hampshire, England.2

Children of Rt. Hon. William Graham Nicholson and Alice Margaret Beach

Otho William Nicholson+2 b. 30 Nov 1891

Lt.-Col. John Humphrey Nicholson2 b. 14 Sep 1893

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 2, page 2895. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S37] BP2003. [S37]

Rt. Hon. William Wither Bramston Beach1

M, #541839, b. 25 December 1826, d. 3 August 1901

Last Edited=14 Mar 2017

Rt. Hon. William Wither Bramston Beach was born on 25 December 1826.2 He was the son of William Beach and Jane Henrietta Browne.2 He married Caroline Chichester Cleveland, daughter of Colonel Augustus Cleveland, on 8 October 1857.2 He died on 3 August 1901 at age 74.2

He graduated from Oxford University, Oxford, Oxfordshire, England, with a Master of Arts (M.A.)2 He gained the rank of Major in the Hampshire Yeomanry Cavalry.2 He held the office of Member of Parliament (M.P.) for Hampshire between 1857 and 1885.1 He held the office of Member of Parliament (M.P.) for West Hampshire between 1885 and 1901.2 He was appointed Privy Counsellor (P.C.)1 He held the office of Deputy Lieutenant (D.L.) of Hampshire.2 He lived at Oakley Manor, Basingstoke, Hampshire, England.2 He lived at Keevil Manor, Wiltshire, England.2 He held the office of Justice of the Peace (J.P.) for Hampshire.2

Children of Rt. Hon. William Wither Bramston Beach and Caroline Chichester Cleveland

Alice Margaret Beach+2 d. 8 May 1935

Major Archibald William Beach+2 b. 21 Oct 1859, d. 22 Jan 1924

Ellice Michael Beach2 b. 31 Mar 1875, d. 6 Sep 1948

Citations
